i1.name: An_Acquired_Taste
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Tahm Kench's''' [[basic attack]]s {{tip|on-hit}} and ''{{ai|Tongue Lash|Tahm Kench}}'' deal {{pp|8 to 60|color=magic damage}} {{as|(+ 4% of his '''bonus''' health)}} {{as|'''bonus''' magic damage}}, and apply a stack of ''An Acquired Taste'' against enemy {{tip|champions}} lasting 5 seconds, which refreshes on subsequent hits and stacks up to 3 times. Stacks expire by 1 every {{fd|0.67}} seconds.
''{{ai|Tongue Lash|Tahm Kench}}'' and ''{{ai|Devour|Tahm Kench}}'' gain additional effects against enemies with 3 stacks, consuming them all.
i1.descriptionHtml:
Innate: Tahm Kench's basic attacks on-hit and Tahm Kench's Tongue Lash deal 8 − 60 (based on level) (+ 4% of his bonus health) bonus magic damage, and apply a stack of An Acquired Taste against enemy champions lasting 5 seconds, which refreshes on subsequent hits and stacks up to 3 times. Stacks expire by 1 every 0.67 seconds.
Tahm Kench's Tongue Lash and Tahm Kench's Devour gain additional effects against enemies with 3 stacks, consuming them all.
i1.notes: * The passive bonus damage applies to turrets.

q1.name: Tongue_Lash
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Tahm Kench''' lashes his tongue in the target direction that deals {{as|magic damage}} to the first enemy hit and {{tip|slows}} them by 50% for 2 seconds. If this hits an enemy {{tip|champion}}, '''Tahm Kench''' also {{tip|heals}} himself.

{{sbc|{{ai|An Acquired Taste|Tahm Kench}} Bonus:}} The target is {{tip|stun|stunned}} for {{fd|1.5}} seconds. ''{{ai|Devour|Tahm Kench}}'' can be cast during ''Tongue Lash'' at no cost to pull the target to '''Tahm Kench''' before swallowing them.

'''''Tahm Kench''' is {{tip|lockout|unable}} to move, attack, or cast {{ai|Abyssal Dive|Tahm Kench}} or {{ai|Devour|Tahm Kench}} on a different target while his tongue is in flight. Tongue Lash's range and travel speed can be increased by '''Tahm Kench's''' [[size]].''
q1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Tahm Kench lashes his tongue in the target direction that deals magic damage to the first enemy hit and slows them by 50% for 2 seconds. If this hits an enemy champion, Tahm Kench also heals himself.
Tahm Kench's An Acquired Taste Bonus: The target is stunned for 1.5 seconds. Tahm Kench's Devour can be cast during Tongue Lash at no cost to pull the target to Tahm Kench before swallowing them.
Tahm Kench is unable to move, attack, or cast Tahm Kench's Abyssal Dive or Tahm Kench's Devour on a different target while his tongue is in flight. Tongue Lash's range and travel speed can be increased by Tahm Kench's size.
leveling:
{{st|Magic Damage|{{ap|80 to 280}} {{as|(+ 70% AP)}}
{{ai|An Acquired Taste|Tahm Kench|(+ {{pp|8 to 60|color=magic damage}} {{as|(+ 4% '''bonus''' health)}})}}}} {{st|Heal|{{ap|10 to 30}} {{as|(+ {{ap|3 to 5}}% of '''missing''' health)}}}}
q1.notes:
* '''Tongue Lash's''' range and speed scale 1:1 alongside any [[size]] modifiers to '''Tahm Kench''', but will not be reduced ''below'' their base values if his overall size modifier is smaller than 100%.
** As the missile range and speed scale simultaneously, '''Tongue Lash''' will always take {{rutngt|{{#expr: 900/2800}}}} to reach its maximum range (no matter the cast range).
** Because of this, increasing '''Tahm Kench's''' size with items such as {{ii|Frostfire Gauntlet}}, {{ii|Gargoyle Stoneplate}} and/or {{ii|Elixir of Iron}} allows him to hit targets at even the same distance more quickly and giving them less time to dodge.
* {{ai|Devour|Tahm Kench}} can be 'queued' at any point during ''Tongue Lash'' (including the wind-up animation) and will not go on cooldown if '''Tahm Kench''' fails to hit a valid target with ''Tongue Lash''.
* All three {{ai|An Acquired Taste|Tahm Kench}} stacks will be consumed even if ''Tongue Lash's'' {{tip|stun}} is negated.
{{Effect at cast time start}}
{{ct|cast|spells=true,false,false,false,false}}

effects.str:
• Magic Damage: (+ 70% AP)
    Tahm Kench's (+ 8 − 60 (based on level) (+ 4% bonus health))
  • Heal: (+ % of missing health)

st_slices:
(+ 70% AP)
Tahm Kench's (+ 8 − 60 (based on level) (+ 4% bonus health))

w1.name: Abyssal_Dive
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Tahm Kench''' {{tip|channels}} for {{fd|1.35}} seconds as he dives into the waters, then {{tip|blink|blinks}} to the target location after a {{fd|0.15}}-second delay and remains {{tip|lockout|unable to act}} for {{fd|0.65}} seconds after the channel completes.

'''Tahm Kench''' emerges to deal {{as|magic damage}} to nearby enemies, as well as {{tip|airborne|knock up}} and {{tip|stun}} them for 1 second. If this hits at least one enemy {{tip|champion}}, 40% of its {{sti|cooldown}} and {{sti|{{as|mana}}}} cost are refunded.
Enemies can see the indicator for '''Tahm Kench's''' destination after he has channeled for {{fd|0.75}} seconds. '''Tahm Kench''' gains {{tip|sight}} of the area during the channel.
''Abyssal Dive will cast at max range if cast beyond that.''
w1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Tahm Kench channels for 1.35 seconds as he dives into the waters, then blinks to the target location after a 0.15-second delay and remains unable to act for 0.65 seconds after the channel completes.
Tahm Kench emerges to deal magic damage to nearby enemies, as well as knock up and stun them for 1 second. If this hits at least one enemy champion, 40% of its cooldown and mana cost are refunded.
Enemies can see the indicator for Tahm Kench's destination after he has channeled for 0.75 seconds. Tahm Kench gains sight of the area during the channel.
Abyssal Dive will cast at max range if cast beyond that.

e1.name: Thick_Skin
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Tahm Kench''' stores a portion of the {{tt|post-mitigation damage|Damage calculated after modifiers}} he takes as [[Health#Grey health|grey health]] on his [[health bar]], increased while there are at least 2 nearby {{tip|sight|visible}} enemy champions either dead or alive. He can store up to {{as|300% of his '''maximum''' health}}.

While ''Thick Skin'' is off cooldown, and after 4 seconds without taking damage, '''Tahm Kench''' rapidly consumes his [[Health#Grey health|grey health]] to restore {{pp|key=%|45 to 100}} of the amount, {{tip|healing}} {{as|10% of his '''maximum''' health}} every {{rutngt|0.25}}.
{{sbc|Active:}} '''Tahm Kench''' converts his current [[Health#Grey health|grey health]] into a {{tip|shield}} that lasts for {{fd|2.5}} seconds.
e1.descriptionHtml:
Passive: Tahm Kench stores a portion of the post-mitigation damage he takes as Health#Grey health on his health bar, increased while there are at least 2 nearby visible enemy champions either dead or alive. He can store up to 300% of his maximum health.
While Thick Skin is off cooldown, and after 4 seconds without taking damage, Tahm Kench rapidly consumes his Health#Grey health to restore 45% − 100% (based on level) of the amount, healing 10% of his maximum health every 0.264.
Active: Tahm Kench converts his current Health#Grey health into a shield that lasts for 2.5 seconds.
leveling:
{{st|Damage Stored into Grey Health|{{ap|13 to 45}}%}}
{{st|Increased Damage Stored into Grey Health|{{ap|40 to 50}}%}}
e1.notes:
* ''Thick Skin'' shield value and ''grey health'' percentage heal are both boosted by effects that increase heal and shield power. This means '''Tahm Kench''' can technically heal more than the normal amount of ''grey health'' and get a shield bigger than his maximum health.
** At level 18 '''Tahm Kench''' would need {{ap|(1/0.65-1)*100|round=1}}% {{sti|heal power}} to heal for 100% of the damage he takes, reduced to {{ap|(1/(0.65*1.1)-1.05)*100|round=1}}% with {{ri|Revitalize}}, {{ap|(1/(0.65*1.25)-1)*100|round=1}}% with {{ii|Spirit Visage}}, and {{ap|(1/(0.65*1.1*1.25)-1.05)*100|round=1}}% with both.
* ''Grey health'' converts all post-mitigation damage, ''Thick Skin'' effectively grants ''Tahm Kench'' a form of {{as|true damage}} mitigation.
* ''Grey health'' can temporarily exceed 100% of his missing health when '''Tahm Kench''' {{tt|heals through other means|Any other source of healing besides Thick Skin}} with a ''grey health'' bar at 100%. In that case he will keep the higher ''grey health'' value for a few moments until it updates and removes the amount that he healed.

effects.str:
• Damage Stored into Grey Health: %
  • Increased Damage Stored into Grey Health: %

st_slices: Increased Damage Stored into Grey Health

subeffects.title: Increased Damage Stored into Grey Health

r1.name: Devour
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Tahm Kench''' swallows the target {{tip|champion}} for up to 3 seconds, rendering them {{tip|untargetable}} and {{tip|displacement immune}}. ''Devour'' can be cast on enemies only with 3 stacks of ''{{ai|An Acquired Taste|Tahm Kench}}''.

If the target is an ally, they become {{tip|lockout|unable to act}} and are granted a {{tip|shield}} for {{fd|2.5}} seconds, refreshing after being ''{{ai|Regurgitate|Tahm Kench|Regurgitated}}''. '''Tahm Kench''' will also gain {{sti|{{as|40% '''bonus''' movement speed}}}} for 3 seconds and is unable to cast movement spells besides ''{{ai|Abyssal Dive|Tahm Kench}}'' while an ally is swallowed.

After a 1 second delay, '''Tahm Kench''' can cast ''{{ai|Regurgitate|Tahm Kench}}'' within the duration, and automatically does so afterwards. The swallowed ally can also input a movement command to force this cast in the target direction, unless they are {{tip|immobilize|immobilized}}.

{{sbc|{{ai|An Acquired Taste|Tahm Kench}} Bonus:}} The target is {{tip|suppression|suppressed}} while swallowed. '''Tahm Kench''' will also be {{tip|grounded}} and {{tip|slow|slowed}} by 40% while an enemy is swallowed.
''If '''Tahm Kench''' is performing {{ai|Abyssal Dive|Tahm Kench}}, {{ai|Regurgitate|Tahm Kench}} will not automatically cast until after he finishes.''
r1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Tahm Kench swallows the target champion for up to 3 seconds, rendering them untargetable and displacement immune. Devour can be cast on enemies only with 3 stacks of Tahm Kench's An Acquired Taste.
If the target is an ally, they become unable to act and are granted a shield for 2.5 seconds, refreshing after being Tahm Kench's Regurgitated. Tahm Kench will also gain 40% bonus movement speed for 3 seconds and is unable to cast movement spells besides Tahm Kench's Abyssal Dive while an ally is swallowed.
After a 1 second delay, Tahm Kench can cast Tahm Kench's Regurgitate within the duration, and automatically does so afterwards. The swallowed ally can also input a movement command to force this cast in the target direction, unless they are immobilized.
Tahm Kench's An Acquired Taste Bonus: The target is suppressed while swallowed. Tahm Kench will also be grounded and slowed by 40% while an enemy is swallowed.
If Tahm Kench is performing Tahm Kench's Abyssal Dive, Tahm Kench's Regurgitate will not automatically cast until after he finishes.
r1.notes:
* ''Devour'' will end prematurely under the following circumstances:
** The enemy target {{tip|cleanse|cleanses}} the {{tip|suppression}}.
** '''Tahm Kench''' or his target dies.
*** If he dies during the cast time, the target will be dealt ''{{ais|Regurgitate|Tahm Kench}}'' damage.
** '''Tahm Kench''' enters {{tip|resurrection}}.
*** If he enters resurrection during the cast time, the target will be dealt ''{{ais|Regurgitate|Tahm Kench}}'' damage.
** '''Tahm Kench''' or his target enters or leaves the ''{{ai|Realm of Death|Mordekaiser}}''.
*** If the caster of that ability enters the realm, they will be ''{{ai|Regurgitate|Tahm Kench|Regurgitated}}'' instead.
* ''Devour'' cannot be used on allies that are {{tip|channel|channeling}} or using an ability that preloads {{tip|unstoppableforcemarker|UnstoppableForceMarker}}.
* ''Devour's'' swallow will be resisted by enemies that are {{tip|displacement immune}}.
* The target becomes {{tip|untargetable}} and {{tip|displacement immune}} on-cast.
** Enemy targets will become {{tip|suppression|suppressed}} on-cast.
*** If the target {{tip|cleanse|cleanses}} the suppression during the cast time they will not be swallowed at the end of the cast time.
* Swallowed enemy champions will receive the recast's damage regardless of how they exit.
* The {{tip|slow|self-slow}} is affected by {{tip|slow resist}}.
* '''Tahm Kench''' cannot use {{tip|Hex-gate|hex-gates}} during ''Devour''.
* Allies can see if this spell is ready next to '''Tahm Kench's''' health bar.
* The swallowed target is not considered to be {{tip|vanish|vanished}}. They are instead hidden underground to maintain ongoing effects such as {{cai|Curse of the Black Mist|Senna}}.
* The following table refers for interactions while the target is unable to act:
{{ct|attack=false|move=If an ally, forces '''Tahm Kench''' to use {{ai|Regurgitate|Tahm Kench}} unless movement commands are otherwise restricted. If an enemy, movement commands are disabled.|cast=false|items=false|consume=false|spells=false|interrupts=death}}
{{ct|cast|items=false|consume=false|spells=true,false,false,false,false}}
r1.cooldown_warn: Wiki's and Riot's cooldowns do not match: Wiki's value '{{tt|{{ap|120 to 80}}|Starts post-effect, but time spent active will be reduced by current cooldown afterwards}}' as '120/100/80' and riot's value '0,0,0' as '0'

r2.name: Regurgitate
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Tahm Kench''' {{tip|airborne|spits}} the swallowed champion in the target direction. If they are an enemy, he deals {{as|magic damage}} to them at the end of the displacement.
r2.descriptionHtml: Active: Tahm Kench spits the swallowed champion in the target direction. If they are an enemy, he deals magic damage to them at the end of the displacement.
leveling: {{st|Magic Damage|{{ap|100 to 400}} {{as|(+ 15% {{as|(+ 5% per 100 AP)}} of the target's '''maximum''' health)}}}}
r2.notes:
* ''Regurgitate'' will also automatically cast if '''Tahm Kench''' or his target is affected by {{ai|Fate's Call|Kalista}} or his target enters {{tip|resurrection}}.
* '''Tahm Kench''' becomes {{tip|lockout|unable to act}} for {{fd|0.25}} seconds upon casting ''Regurgitate''.
r2.cost_warn: Wiki's and Riot's mana costs do not match: Wiki's value  0 as 0 and riot's value 100,100,100 as 100

effects.str: • Magic Damage: (+ 15% (+ 5% per 100 AP) of the target's maximum health)

st_slices: (+ 15% (+ 5% per 100 AP) of the target's maximum health)
